text: Revere is an unincorporated community in Whitman County, in the U.S. state of Washington. ==History== A post office called Revere was established in 1909, and remained in operation until it was discontinued in 1935. The community was named for Paul Revere, a patriot in the American Revolution. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Whitman County, Washington Category:Unincorporated communities in Washington (state)
title: Revere, Washington
